meanings.definition: To drink greedily or in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: After playing outside, the kids would guzzle their water bottles.
meanings.sent2: The thirsty man would guzzle down his soda in one go.
meanings.sent3: The dog would guzzle his water so fast, he ended up with a wet chin.
meanings.sent4: She guzzled the information from the book like a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The engine guzzled fuel as it raced down the track.

meanings.definition: A large amount of liquid consumed quickly.
meanings.sent1: The guzzle of milk spilled over the edge of the glass.
meanings.sent2: He took a big guzzle of the refreshing lemonade.
meanings.sent3: The guzzle of juice was so satisfying on a hot day.
meanings.sent4: The waterfall's guzzle echoed through the canyon.
meanings.sent5: The guzzle of rain filled the empty barrel in no time.
